html:
** Electric vehicle maker Rivian Automotive Inc RIVN.O, backed by Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O and Ford Motor Co F.N, set for highly anticipated debut after IPO sees strong demand

** Rivian sold 153 mln shares at $78, well above an already upwardly revised range, raising $12 bln in IPO ranked among the 10 biggest of all time in the U.S. (Full Story)

** Shares to begin trading on Weds on Nasdaq with symbol "RIVN"

** The Tesla TSLA.O rival, which posted roughly $1 bln net loss in first half of 2021, said had about 55,400 pre-orders for its R1T pickup trucks and R1S SUVs in U.S. and Canada as of Oct 31

** Amazon, T. Rowe Price, Franklin Templeton, Capital Research and Blackstone among a group of "cornerstone investors" who indicated to buy up to $5 bln of the offering, per the prospectus filing

** RIVN generated the most new watchers in last 24 hours on social media site Stocktwits, viewed commonly as measure of retail investor interest

** Morgan Stanley, Goldman and JP Morgan leading 22-firm underwriting group for the IPO


(Lance Tupper is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own)

(( lance.tupper.tr.com@reuters.net
lance.tupper@tr.com 1-332-219-1430) )
